jobs.title: Senior Product Manager (Platform Squad)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Homebound is on a mission to make it possible for anyone, anywhere, to build a home using technology. Created by an experienced team of construction, real estate, design, and technology experts, Homebound is transforming the residential construction industry by improving the costly and inefficient process of building a home. 

We’ve created an entirely new way to build homes with technology powering every stage from start to finish to provide a seamless experience for our customers. Homeowners across the country can choose where they want to live, select a home plan that’s perfect for them, then personalize and buy it, all online. Homebound has raised $150M in capital from leading venture capitalists like Google, Khosla, Thrive Ventures, and we’re scaling quickly in places like Texas, Colorado and Florida. Come build your future with us.

Homebound is proud to be named one of Inc.’s Best Workplaces of 2023.

About the Role

We're excited to bring on a Senior Product Manager to lead the Platform Squad, who are responsible for Homebound's core technology foundation and our internal platform - Blueprint. Blueprint powers every stage of our construction lifecycle - from plan development to design packages, procurement, budgeting, and field execution. As we scale, this platform is evolving into a deeply integrated, AI powered system that connects teams and data across our business.

In this role, you’ll own the roadmap, execution, and success metrics for the Platform Squad. You’ll partner with engineering, design, and operations stakeholders to deliver powerful, intuitive tools that drive efficiency, profitability, and consistency across Homebound’s end-to-end process.

You’ll be both strategic and hands-on - translating business goals into actionable product strategy, leading discovery and design, and ensuring every release delivers measurable impact.

What You’ll Do

  • Own the Platform roadmap and execution: Define the vision, strategy, and priorities for Blueprint and related platform services.

  • Run a high-performing squad: Partner with design and engineering to deliver high-quality releases on time, using agile best practices.

  • Deeply understand users: Collaborate with internal teams across plan development, design, procurement, and construction to understand pain points and translate them into scalable, elegant solutions.

  • Write clear, outcome-driven product briefs that define problems, user stories, success metrics, and go-to-market implications.

  • Acceptance test releases to ensure functionality, quality, and alignment with product intent before launch.

  • Drive continuous feedback loops: Gather insights from users, data, and leadership to refine features and prioritize future investments.

  • Integrate emerging technologies: Partner with engineering and AI teams to identify opportunities to automate workflows and unlock new levels of efficiency.

  • Measure impact: Define KPIs for adoption, cycle time, and margin improvement; use data to evaluate results and drive iteration.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally: Align stakeholders across Product, Operations, Finance, and Engineering to ensure the platform scales with business needs and features that are built are widely adopted across the company.

  • Be a decisive, thoughtful product leader: Balance short-term impact with long-term platform health and maintain a clear perspective on tradeoffs.

What You’ll Bring

  • 5+ years of product management experience, including ownership of a complex product or platform with significant internal users.

  • Strong experience leading agile software teams and managing full product lifecycles - from discovery to delivery.

  • Proven ability to translate ambiguous business challenges into clear product strategies and roadmaps.

  • Strong technical fluency - comfortable collaborating with engineers on APIs, data models, integrations, and architectural tradeoffs.

  • Excellent product sense and judgment - able to balance user needs, operational realities, and business impact.

  • Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to influence and align cross-functional partners at all levels.

  • Analytical mindset with a track record of using metrics to inform decisions and evaluate success.

  • Experience in or passion for construction, proptech, or complex operational systems is a strong plus.

  • Curiosity, ownership, and a bias toward action - you drive results and make decisions quickly, with confidence and empathy.

Why Homebound?
We’re building the future of residential construction - powered by a connected platform and a relentless focus on quality. If you’re passionate about creating tools that actually get used in the real world and make a measurable difference, you’ll thrive here.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. To apply, please submit an application with your resume on the Career’s page.

  • Have full knowledge of target prospect base and manage an ongoing prospect pipeline

  • Report to sales leadership on numbers including outreach, connected calls, meetings scheduled, etc.

  • You have experience as an outbound prospector, including making cold calls, sending emails, and prospecting using tools like LinkedIn.

  • You have a track record of personal accountability, and a high standard of integrity and professionalism.

  • You’ve demonstrated resilience and a desire to succeed in the face of new and/or unforeseen challenges.

  • You are a team-player with a strong desire to help enforce and improve internal processes.

  • A desire to learn, grow and get in on the ground floor of a company that is changing how homeowners build homes

  • You are receptive to feedback, with the willingness to learn and embrace continuous improvement

  • Bachelor's Degree with 1-2+ years of experience in a sales-related role

  • Background in homebuilding, real estate or construction sales is a bonus!

Come build your future with us.

Homebound is proud to be named one of Inc.’s Best Workplaces of 2023.

Role Overview
We’re looking for a Director of Marketing who can set the vision, build strategy, and lead execution across our marketing ecosystem. This is a high-impact, cross-functional leadership role for someone excited to architect and scale marketing programs across paid media, lifecycle email, social, and geo-specific campaigns.

You’ll shape our full-funnel strategy to drive qualified leads, educate long-consideration buyers, and strengthen our presence across diverse regional markets. You’ll collaborate with executive leadership and build the foundation for scalable, measurable growth in a fast-paced, startup environment.

Applicants for this position must be located in the Dallas Fort-Worth area.

What You’ll Do

  • Define and lead multi-channel marketing strategy across email, paid media, social, and regional campaigns, ensuring alignment with company goals.

  • Build and optimize nurture programs that deepen engagement and trust with long-lead buyers, shaping the customer journey from first touch to close.

  • Oversee paid media investments across Google Ads, Meta, and Connected TV, setting budgets, optimizing performance, and driving ROI for real estate–specific lead generation.

  • Shape the company’s social media presence and content strategy to strengthen brand awareness and engagement at scale.

  • Develop and implement market-specific go-to-market strategies (e.g., suburban lot expansion in Texas, rebuild efforts in California), ensuring tailored approaches for regional opportunities.

  • Use analytics and reporting tools (Google Analytics, Salesforce/Pardot) to set KPIs, monitor performance, and drive data-backed decisions.

  • Partner with Sales, Product Marketing, and Design to align campaigns with business objectives and customer needs.

  • Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing marketing team, fostering a culture of creativity, accountability, and measurable impact.

What We’re Looking For

  • 8+ years of experience in growth, lifecycle, or integrated marketing, with increasing leadership responsibilities; must have homebuilding industry experience.

  • Proven ability to design and scale full-funnel marketing strategies that drive measurable business impact.

  • Expertise across key channels: paid media, lifecycle email, social media, and analytics, with ability to balance hands-on execution and high-level strategy.

  • Strong leadership, communication, and project management skills, with experience building and mentoring teams.

  • Proficiency in tools such as Salesforce/Pardot, Google Ads, Meta Ads, and Google Analytics; experience with offline channels (e.g., direct mail) is a plus.

  • A strategic, entrepreneurial mindset with a track record of building programs from the ground up in a fast-paced environment.

  • Deploy high-quality production code on a daily basis

Homebound Project Managers are responsible for the effective coordination of groups of single-family building projects. Project Managers coordinate across all functional teams at Homebound while utilizing our proprietary project management software to manage their projects.

  • Be able to manage schedules for multiple homes in different stages of construction.

  • Report to the Director of Construction Operations on the overall health of your projects.

  • Maintain electronic project records including meeting notes and communications.

  • Follow detailed operational processes around communication, change management, and project financial management.

  • Approve all trade partner’s invoices with regard to work completeness and quality.

  • Review daily activity logs of all activities on the job sites you manage.

  • Advise, as needed, on plans and specifications.

  • Report to the Director of Construction Operations on all aspects of assigned project performance, including schedules, budgets, and the safety conditions of your projects.

  • Perform all other duties or assigned as required.

  • Participate in client walks with the Project Team as required.

  • 6+ years of experience in residential home construction as a Project Superintendent or Project Manager.

  • Deep understanding of the LA county permitting, inspections and certificate of occupancy process.

Homebound is proud to be named one of Inc.’s Best Workplaces of 2023.

About the Role

We’re excited to bring on a Senior Product Manager to lead the Apps Squad, the team responsible for Homebound’s customer- and partner-facing digital experiences — including Online Buying , Homeowner Journey , Trade Network, Field App and new interactive experiences that bring our homes and communities to life.

This squad builds the products that make Homebound’s experience magical for everyone outside our walls — guiding homebuyers through design personalization, construction progress, and warranty support, while enabling our trade partners to collaborate seamlessly.

As Senior Product Manager, you’ll own the roadmap and strategy for these experiences, working closely with design, engineering, marketing, and operations to deliver intuitive, high-quality digital products that delight users and strengthen our brand. You’ll balance user empathy and creative vision with a bias for measurable impact and continuous improvement.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead the Apps Squad: Own the roadmap and execution for all customer- and trade-facing applications — Checkout, Homeowner Portal, Trade Portal, and new model home experiences.

  • Deliver beautiful, intuitive user experiences: Collaborate closely with design to create polished, high-performing digital products that reflect Homebound’s brand and simplify complex journeys.

  • Translate customer insights into action: Talk directly with users — homebuyers, homeowners, and trade partners — to uncover pain points, test concepts, and validate solutions.

  • Own the end-to-end lifecycle: Write product briefs, define user stories, prioritize backlogs, and acceptance test releases to ensure every product meets Homebound’s standards for quality and usability.

  • Partner cross-functionally: Work with marketing, operations, and engineering to ensure smooth launches and adoption across multiple audiences.

  • Champion experimentation and iteration: Use analytics and user feedback to measure engagement, identify opportunities, and drive continuous improvement.

  • Shape the future of the Homebound experience: Lead discovery for new digital products — including our next-generation model home and suburban experience — from concept to prototype to launch.

  • Align business goals with user needs: Balance creative, human-centered design with data-driven decision-making to drive growth and customer satisfaction.

What You’ll Bring

  • 5+ years of product management experience building digital consumer or partner-facing products.

  • A strong track record of delivering exceptional user experiences, ideally across web and mobile.

  • Experience leading cross-functional squads of engineers, designers, and stakeholders through the full product lifecycle.

  • Deep user empathy and qualitative research instincts — you naturally seek to understand users’ goals and emotions.

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to align creative, technical, and business perspectives.

  • Comfort working with analytics tools and user data to inform prioritization and measure impact.

  • Experience in proptech, e-commerce, or consumer apps is a strong plus.

  • A creative, resourceful mindset — you thrive in ambiguity and love transforming ideas into polished, impactful products.


Why Homebound?
We’re building the future of residential construction - powered by a connected platform and a relentless focus on quality. If you’re passionate about creating tools that actually get used in the real world and make a measurable difference, you’ll thrive here.
